required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Counselling Delivered Through Native Mobile Application on Work Ability and Work Recovery Among Micro-entrepreneurs

brief_summary.textblock:
A randomized intervention study to promote work recovery and work ability among micro-entrepreneurs. The main aim is to investigate if the use of Recovery! -application results in better work recovery and work ability than no treatment for micro-entrepreneurs.
The plan of action of the study merges: 1) the contents that are based on the needs of the target population and evidence from research on work related and health behaviour enhancing work recovery, 2) theoretical framework for the counselling, 3) counselling methods including behaviour change techniques, and 4) tailoring the content and counselling according to trans theoretical change model and physical work demands. The intervention is delivered through native mobile application designed by using the abovementioned methodology.
Data are collected by repeated internet-based questionnaires (at baseline, 2 and 6 months from the beginning of the intervention) and from the use of mobile application. Furthermore, randomly selected persons in two groups (20-30 persons in each) are interviewed. Process evaluation is conducted to detect the mechanisms of change and to study why the program succeeded or failed.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: randomized intervention trial with waiting list control

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in need for recovery scale at 6 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in need for recovery scale at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: need for recovery scale measures early symptoms of fatigue

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in perceived work ability at 6 months. One item of work ability index
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in perceived work ability at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: to rate their work ability on a scale of 0 to 10, ten being their lifetime best work ability

secondary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in 3-item version of the Utrecht Work Engagement Scale at 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in 3-item version of the Utrecht Work Engagement Scale at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: "At my work, I feel bursting with energy" (vigor); (2) "I am enthusiastic about my job"(dedication);(3)"I am immersed in my work" (absorption)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Recovery Experiences Questionnaire at 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in Recovery Experiences at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Recovery Experience Questionnaire - a Measure for assessing recuperation and unwinding from work

secondary_outcome.measure: World health organization Health and work performance questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in work performance at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: World health organization Health and work performance questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in sleep deprivation at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep deprivation is calculated by subtracting hours slept from hours of sleep needed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in insomnia symptoms at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Symptoms of insomnia are difficulties falling asleep, waking up at nights, waking up too early in the morning unable to fall asleep again and feeling of sleep which does not refresh. How often have you had this kind of symptoms during last 3 months?" Answers were given using Likert-scale: 1) Never or less than once a month, 2) less than once a week, 3) 1-2 days a week, 4) 3-5 days a week or 5) daily or almost daily.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in nutritional behaviour at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: number of meals and snacks per day

secondary_outcome.measure: Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test Consumption (Audit-C)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in Audit-C at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: the Finnish version of the questionnaire Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test Consumption 3 questions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in physical activity at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: frequency in light and brisk physical activities (daily, four to six times a week, two to three times a week, once a week, two to three times a month, and once a month or less often). The duration of one bout of activity was considered separately for light and brisk activities (over 90 minutes, 60 to 90 minutes, 40 to59 minutes, 20 to 39 minutes, less than 20 minutes, and not at all)

other_outcome.description: dose of Recover application (using time in hours and minutes during two months)

intervention.description: Recover! app: one hour weekly for two months
no treatment during 6 months,then Recover! app

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Finnish-speaking micro-entrepreneurs (those with enterprise of 1-9 employees),
- company is located in Finland.
- work full-time as entrepreneurs,
- understand Finnish,
- use an Android phone.
Exclusion Criteria:
- not full-time entrepreneurs
- on sick leave
- absent from work
